etymology.description: Pictogram (象形) – hanging piece of cloth.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a cloth draped and hanging, with the long stroke as the edge and the shorter strokes suggesting the folds. The image conveys a towel or piece of fabric suspended from a line or rod.

examples.chinese: 我用湿毛巾擦脸(我用濕毛巾擦臉)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yòng shī máojīn cā liǎn.
examples.english: I use a wet towel to wipe my face.

examples.chinese: 她戴着红色的头巾(她戴著紅色的頭巾)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dài zhe hóngsè de tóujīn.
examples.english: She is wearing a red headscarf.

examples.chinese: 冬天出门要围上围巾(冬天出門要圍上圍巾)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān chūmén yào wéi shàng wéijīn.
examples.english: In winter, put on a scarf before going out.
